channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overhanging vegetation, 25th June
item.description:
Please cut back over hanging vegetation. Obstructing vision when the resident is coming out of their driveway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Paul's Wood Hill, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Baker street outside 216 to 222 , volunteer pub outside, 25th June
item.description:
Bags of rubbish haven't collected yet on Baker street need to clear out from pavement few on next to bin outside 216 to 222 also outside the volunteer pub.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 218-226, Baker Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction of orange beacon for bike and zebra crossing, 25th June
item.description:
Going East the crossing flashing beacon is obscured completely by a blue road sign describing the crossing is also for bikes. I have witnessed two near misses . The sign needs to be moved or lowered imo. Going west the beacon flashing can be seen easily
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): John Campbell Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox found on our path this morning, 25th June
item.description:
I found a dead fox on the path up to 67c Croydon Road this morning. I think it died overnight because rigor mortis had started to set in. I have put it in two heavy duty bin bags and the bag is currently behind the bins in the front garden.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing communal bin, 25th June
item.description:
For over a month we have one bin less. It means rubbish overflows by collection day. The animals then open and drag all the waste around. It’s leading to rats having a field day.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Longfield Crescent, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped in the Alleyway between 275 and 277 Upper Wickham Lane, 25th June
item.description:
Rubbish dumped in the alleyway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Wickham Lane, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Car vandalised & creating nuisance, 25th June
item.description:
This vehicle has been in this position for 6 weeks - it’s filthy it’s being vandalised- it’s stopping road cleaners for cleaning the gutter - there is a large volume of rubbish around the vehicle! It may be taxed but it’s clearly dumped and is not owned by anyone in the top end of Albert Road! It’s also attracting drug deals as it’s under the trees on a small path and you can hear them at night! This is the 2nd report I know it’s taxed but it’s clearly dumped please contact the owner!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Albert Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 32-A Glenilla Road, 25th June
item.description:
Damaged, cracked and uneven pavement which will lead to slips/trips/falls.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Glenilla Road, Belsize Park, London

item.title: Fly tipping, 25th June
item.description:
I am the manager of Shoreditch Adventure playground which is part of Hackneys Children and Families Service. This is the 3rd time we had been victims of fly tipping and we cannot access the gate due to a large wood pile that has been dumped.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cranston Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
